The moment I say school, so many
memories are comes back to
me. It's like after every exam when I
walk out, the teacher would say, "Hey,
come, how did you do?" I would say with
a great smile I will definitely pass and
I didn't understand why in one hand they
say speak the truth in the other hand
when you say the truth they hated you.
So it went on like that and I don't know
you know where else to find
myself. So I remember those nights I
used to go to sleep with uh asking help
from
Anko because for some reason I couldn't
believe what my father and mother have
it in a puja room as a god because of
course my friend's family has something
else as a god. So I thought just I will
pray to unknown and ask
help and uh started getting help from
everywhere each and every corner of my
life at that time. My brother started
giving me a few tips about drawing and
painting. Then when I was an eighth
standard uh around 13 years old, I
started working in a part-time job in
one of the signboard artists called
Pu.
Then school also started supporting me.
Oh, he's bad in studies but let him send
to the drawing competitions.
So it was good to survive with that
little tool you know I found to find my
own place in
school. In one of those competition I
just won a small little transistor pip
radio and I didn't have a patience to
wait until I reach home. So I just
switched on in the train loudly if you
travel in Indian train you can see
people listen to radio and you know even
from the mobile. So at that time when I
was 13 you know I was listening
to just radio and someone happened sit
next to me like the three people are
sitting here you know like just adjacent
to me he just started asking where did
you bought the radio how much is it I
said it's a price from art competition
then he said oh I teach in college of
arts I think you
should study in school of art you just
quit school and come there so why I'm
telling you this you know Maybe you know
whoever is sitting next to you can
change your whole life. It's possible.
It's just that we need to be open and
fine-tuned. So that's what made me to
enter college of arts after three
attempts and just continue to inquire
what I really want to do with artworks
or art and finally I'm here in front of
you. When I look back you know on what
happened between that time and now you
know here the last 101 15 years I can
see that the most of the works are
revolved around three subjects but it
was not intentional you know I just
started with trace because I was
thinking what really makes us you know
it's actually past you know what makes
the
present so I was thinking but when
you look at the past the way to
understand the past is only by the
traces available because we cannot go
back to past. It can be rules or it can
be music or it can be painting or
drawing or writing whatever it is but
it's just a kind of a trace of that
time and that fascinated me to explore
that territory.
So I was like working on the line that
instead
of working about traces I started
capturing
traces. So here are some of the works
I'd like to show you. So this is called
self in progress. It's just a trace of
being in this body. So here what
happened that you know what I really
enjoyed the most is like this culture is
nothing but trace from myself.
It's almost like a 3D photograph. So
there is an element of performance and
there is an element of sculpture and
there is an element of feeling oneself
so close to oneself. So it's almost like
fossil for future and then moved slowly
to explore the other possibilities of
capturing traes.
So this is what I was talking about
while molding you know it's such a great

like walking or moving my hand or you
know moving around in the space but the
moment this becomes solid when you
cannot move even an inch because this is

it's almost like a hot
stone. So this is capturing trace of

I'm going to capture thumbrint footprint
or you know whatever we leave trace as a

fire this is trace of

you know this thought comes to me always
like you know is it only when the object

trace or is it other way to capture it.
So this work is nothing but like because

show what is on the other side.
So I just put the paper on the focal

I got the portrait of sun from

What I did here I just put like 10 ft

get this line. So wherever the fire is
eating the paper that's what becomes the
word
detail. Even though we have traces when

because even though there are traces
when we try to understand them you know
you play a major role so like let's say

just raise a

the answer can be so different. If
plotter said he would say for the

definitely
say God came down from heaven and he

Freud would say the fact that you are at

sexual

So what we see is just what we think
often and most of the time we don't see
what it is. It just all depends on one's
perception and uh context. What is
really context? You know I could just
show with this little piece of paper
because I always think meaning doesn't
really
exist. The meaning what we create in
this world doesn't exist. It just
created by the mind. If you look at this
piece of
paper, this is the
breadth and this is called length. This
is how we had been taught in
school. But if it's here, it's in the
middle. Now I didn't touch this breath
but still the meaning of this changes.
So what we conceive as a meaning is
always not there. It's on the other
side. Even when we say dark, light,
good, bad, tall, short, all meaning, it
doesn't exist in reality. It's just that
being a human the way how we train to
perceive the reality create this
meaning. So this work from this period
is mostly like you know this is a work
called light makes dark. It's just a
captured suit from the lamp. So the lamp
is not just giving a light, it's also
give a darkness. So this is a work of
art which is just trying to explore
that. This is called in but out. This
shows how limited our eye or hearing
sense or touch do we really see? This is
exact negative. It's about 6 in deep in

coming out of the
wall. You know the wall is almost like
this is the first skin and this is
second and this is the third. You know
which creates a meaning. We're just
pulling the wall of the gallery again in
but out. It's a full figure cast from

deep. when I was doing that you know I
always wondered since I worked with
traces and now you know I moved to the
questioning the perception whenever I
see the bird flying in the sky you know
it just makes me feel like is it
anything behind is it any traces out
there which as a human you know we don't
see them is it any way to capture the
thought into a visual art I couldn't
find
it
but the solution arrived after being
quiet and not working for about six
seven months in a
restroom when I was changing the air
freshener that goes from solid substance
to vapor. It's called
ordinal. This is the work I made out of
that
material. The process to get to make the
sculpture was interesting because I
wrote to Balsara who produced the air
freshener called Ordinal saying dear sir
I'm an artist this is my catalog could
you help me to make this sculpture they
never wrote back to me. Then I thought I
will go to the small scale industries
facilitating unit and ask help. So I
told them I like to start an air
freshener
company. They said of course this is the
fee for the project report and we will
give you all the detail and they gave.
Finally I went back to them and said
it's not for starting the company just
to make my own work. Please come for the
show and they
did. And uh this work is in uh theat
foundation in Delhi in India. Nobody
really talks about works of art. They
always talk about the appreciation of
art. You buy this for 3,000 rupees, it
will become 30,000 in 2 months. This is
the graph was going on. But there are
few collectors who also collect the art
which can depreciate. And this is
collected by Anipam which is like
finally in the end he will not have
anything because it will
evaporate. So this is after few
weeks. This is after a few months. It's
just all about questioning the
preconception. So if someone say, "Oh, I
see the portrait." It may not be the
portrait after few months. And if they
say it's solid, it will not be solid. It
will
evaporate. And if they say they don't
get it, that's also not true because
it's in the air. It's in the same
gallery or in the same museum. So they
inhaled it, but they are not aware of
it.
While I was doing that work, my mom and
my dad they were looking at it and they
say why do you deal with negative
subject all the time and I was like what
do you mean light makes dark and now
evaporating self? Don't you think it's
remains something about death? I said of
course not for me I'm thinking this is
stuck in some small solid but the moment
it evaporate it's it's merged with the
whole but she said no still I don't like
it. Can you make something from nothing
as a sculptor? I said, "No, mama. It
can't be because we can create a
sculpture by gathering a dust together
or we can break the sculpture and get
the dust. But there is no way that we
can bring a dust into the universe." So
I did this work for her. It's called
emerging angel. This is the first day.
It just give an appearance that one is
becoming the other.
So the same sculpture after a few
days. This is after 15 20
days through that small little slit
between the glass box and the wood. The
air goes in and need the sculpture and
create the other one. This gave me a
greater faith that evaporating sculpture
gave me a greater faith that maybe there
is many more possibility to capture
invisible.
So what you see now is called shadow for
shadow. And what I like to tell you is
we don't see shadow and we don't see
light too. We see the source of the
light. We see where it's bouncing but we
don't see as they exist. You know that's
why in the night sky we see the sky is
dark but it's filled with light all the
time. When it's bounced on the moon we
see it. The same thing in the dark room.
The little dust particle will again
reflect the light and we realize that
the existence of light. So we don't see
dark, we don't see light, we don't see
gravity, we don't see
electricity. So I just started doing
this work to
inquire further about how to sculpt the
space between this object and there
because as an visual artist I'm seeing
this and I'm seeing that. But how to
sculpt this? You know if I sculpt this,
this has two reference point. The skin
of this is also representing this and
skin of the other end also represent the
floor. I did this as
a experiment of casting the shadow. So
this is a corrugated box and it shadow.
Then the second one the moment you bring
any you know invisible into a visible
world it will have all the
characteristic of the visible existence.
So that produce a shadow. Then I thought

a shadow. And in the end at that point
there was no shadow. I thought oh good
work is
finished. You can see the
details. This is called gravity.
It's called breath. It's just two holes
on the gallery wall. It's a false wall
which contains like 110 cubic feet. So
that hole is actually make the air comes
out and goes in. So where it's happening
we can see but what's happening will
remain invisible only. This is from the

This is called
cayam detail.
And what I like to tell you that you
know our senses are so limited. We
cannot hear everything. We cannot see
everything. We don't feel I'm touching
the air but if the breeze is a little
more faster then I can feel it. So all
our constriction of the reality is
through this limited senses. So my
request is like is it any way to use all
this as a just a symbol or a
sign and to really get to the point we

like or invisible because when we see

between those footprints and the
footprints are nothing but pass in time.
